snippet: The chaos of civil war has proved to be fertile ground for the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, a revival of Al Qaeda in Iraq, analysts said.
abstract: Chaos of civil war in Syria has proved to be fertile ground for newly named Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, revival of Al Qaeda in Iraq, as it tries to lay groundwork for Islamic state; some Syrian rebels, who initially welcomed support of group, now resent it for putting its internal jihadi agenda ahead of fight to topple government.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, Eric Schmitt from Washington, and an employee of The New York Times from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: The chaos of civil war has proved to be fertile ground for the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, a revival of Al Qaeda in Iraq, analysts said.

headline.main: Qaeda Branch in Syria Pursues Its Own Agenda
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Branch in Syria Pursues Its Own Agenda

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
